alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:02AM EST until January 30 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River. .Lowland flooding is expected to develop along the Wabash from a combination of previous precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on still frozen ground. Expected minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Clinton. * WHEN...From Friday evening to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low bottomlands flood. Water begins to back up local tributaries. River road near Mecca is impassable. Higher county roads and bottomlands begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 19.3 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 215 AM EST /115 AM CST/.
